column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: The seminar covers the application of different Operations Research techniques to a real-world application presented by a company. The particular cases vary from year to year and include public transport planning, vehicle routing, inventory control, etc.
The seminar builds forth on the theory given in all other masters courses. Moreover, good programming skills are required.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Students should be able to formulate a quantitative model for a specific logistic problem.
• Students should be able to defend their model selection and be able to adapt standard operations research model to the sitation on hand.

• They have to be able to formulate the necessary assumptions and evaluate their practical implication; Students have to be able to analyze data to come up with the parameter values needed for the model.
• Students should be able to implement a method in a computer program and give advice for the problem on hand.
• Students have to be able to interpret the results and write a management / scientific report as well a presentation on the results.
<style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112476,2023,Seminar Management Accounting and Control,Engels,Erasmus School of Economics,,['drs. TPM Welten'],,Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: This seminar focuses on the design and use of accounting information for decision making and decision influencing. The emphasis will be on understanding how managers can design and use accounting information to help the organisation achieve its objectives. Some of the topics that will be discussed are Management Control Frameworks, Performance measurement, Incentives, Costing systems, Budgeting and Accouting for non-profits. In this seminar learning will occur trough active participation, class discussion, and self-discipline. To enhance this, the professor will assign each student to a team consisting of 2-4 students. Each team has to write a paper on one of the topics of the seminar, assigned by the professor. Each team will present their paper in the session on that specific topic. One of the other teams has to be the discussant team, and still another team is responsible for chairing the session and stimulate the discussion in class. Each team has to fulfill each of the different roles at least once. The professor will make a schedule at the beginning of the seminar that lists when each team has to perform a specific role. Please note that this seminar is one of the most important parts of the bachelor program. It will be very time-consuming: 12 ECTS in 8 weeks is, on average, 42 hours of work per week.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Students have knowledge of and insights into the “state-of-the-art” in the academic management accounting and control literature on selected topics
• Students are able to apply Management Accounting and Control concepts, theories, and research techniques.
• Students are able to conduct research in the field of Management Accounting and Control resulting in a seminar paper.

• Students are expected to actively participate in the class discussion, to present pieces of the empirical literature, to chair meetings, critically analyse research paper, and to write a paper based on corresponding group assignments.
<style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112447,2023,Seminar Management Control,Engels,Erasmus School of Economics,,['dr. J Zhang', 'dr. W Cao']",,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

• This course discusses the commonly used control mechanisms used by firms such as performance measurement, pay-for-performance systems, target setting, promotion decisions, and corporate governance. In particular, students learn why certain control methods are used, what are the advantages and disadvantages, and how to apply them.
• This course relies on both academic papers and real-life cases to help students understand the control systems and to build connections between theories and problems in practice.
<style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: <body>Students need to write a research report instead of a research proposal this year. This assignment helps students to have a deeper understanding of a specific topic and its implications in practice.</body>
https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112478,2023,Seminar Marketing Strategy,Engels,Erasmus School of Economics,,['dr. BLV Tindemans, MBA', 'drs. MJL van Hasselt, BSc']",,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Marketing strategy are the collection of actions to advance customer relations through research, analysis, and long-term planning. The goal is to gain a competitive advantage and maximize long-term profit. This seminar is designed to synthesize knowledge already acquired in core marketing and strategy courses, and then apply it to specific business cases. The objective is to apply theoretical marketing models and market research methods to real problems. Students will work as individuals and in groups to learn about and analyze case studies and to develop actionable strategic marketing plans. Students will be expected to submit written plans and at times present orally.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Be able to write a strategic marketing plan in a professional and critical way using state-of-the-art literature.
• develop a strategic plan based on theories of firm, consumer and competitor behavior
• be able to present their marketing plan

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/114486,2023,Seminar Omnichannel Marketing,Engels,Erasmus School of Economics,,['dr. SN Brüggemann'],,Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: The focus of this course is on the challenges firms confront in “going to market” – that is, the way in which companies organize to reach and market to their end users. Increasingly, end users and firms are using digital marketing channels, platforms, and technology to interact with each other along the different stages of the value creation process (i.e., the customer journey). Thus, an important challenge is for firms to manage the experiences of their end users effectively and efficiently across channels and over time.

The purpose of this course is to provide the background and analytical skills necessary to understand and manage the interaction process of the effective management of the marketing and distribution aspects of improved end user experiences. The course is organized into three main topic areas: (1) channel selection, (2) channel and experience management, and (3) management within the channel.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: The objectives for this course are for you:
1. To understand the concepts, theory, and latest thinking bearing on the key issues in managing omnichannel customer experiences.
2. To apply concepts, theory, and analytical frameworks to the solution of problems in omnichannel marketing and customer experience management.
3. To conduct appraisals of the go-to-market systems of companies or organizations.
4. To further develop analytical and business communication skills, both oral and written, in problem-solving oriented managerial situations.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112377,2023,Seminar Ports and Global Logistics: Disruptive Scenarios,Engels,Erasmus School of Economics,,['WAA Jacobs'],,Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Scenario planning originates from the military. Scenarios allow military planners to augment enemy moves and get grip on the uncertainties of a dynamic battlefield in order to manage the deployment of troops and military assets effectively. Likewise, international businesses and multinational enterprises operate in various interconnected markets and are exposed to a great variety of risk, non-linearity and complexity. Think about the sudden but enormous impact of Covid-19 on the short term (quarantines, travel bans) and how it might impact on the long term (digital acceleration, deglobalizing supply chains). Scenario planning is used by international businesses as a strategic tool to cope with rapidly changing business environments that are often characterized by disruptions and uncertainty. Thinking in scenarios allow business leaders to augment possible futures on the fortunes of their company upon which they can define various options and strategic investment decisions. In this seminar students will learn how to apply scenario planning as a strategic management tool. Each group of students will write a scenario report for one real-world international company active in shipping, trade and logistics

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Identify various trends and disruptions with an impact on ports, shipping and supply chains
• Generate large amounts of business intelligence from various sources and synthesize these into a coherent strategy.
• Self-organize into groups and communicate results under time pressure.

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112331,2023,Seminar Quantitative Macroeconomics,Engels,Erasmus School of Economics,,['dr. AP Markiewicz'],,Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: The seminar covers a set of timely topics including income inequality, unconventional monetary policy, and the recent (current) pandemic. The seminar's content is technical and the meetings will be highly interactive. In the first part of each lecture, prof. Markiewicz will introduce and explain the theoretical and empirical foundations of each topic. The second part of each lecture will contain the presentations of the related scientific articles by the students. Basic knowledge of macroeconomic models and econometric tools is required for this seminar.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Have up to date knowledge of current macro models.
• Be able to carry out a simple forecasting exercise.
• Know how to estimate a small-scale VAR model.

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112336,2023,Seminar Recent Advances in Economics of Markets and Organisations,Engels,Erasmus School of Economics,,['dr. JA Non'],,Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: During the seminar, academic research papers are presented and discussed by students. Moreover, each student works on a research project (which can, but need not be an extension of one of the papers) and writes a short note on this. Papers are chosen from a list of recent academic research papers on current topics in the economics of markets and organisation. These include both theoretical and empirical papers.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Learn about recent advances in both theoretical and empirical economics of markets and organisations.
• Learn how to present an academic paper in the area of economics of markets and organisations.
• Learn how to formally discuss an academic paper in the area of economics of markets and organisations.
• Learn how to perform a small-scale academic study, either theoretical or empirical, in the area of economics of markets and organisations.
• Learn how to write a short essay reporting research findings.
<style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
